db:abstract.db:para: The QSimpleXmlNodeModel class is an implementation of QAbstractXmlNodeModel sufficient for many common cases.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Subclassing QAbstractXmlNodeModel can be a significant task, because it requires implementing several, complex member functions. QSimpleXmlNodeModel provides default implementations of these member functions that are suitable for a wide range of node models.
Subclasses of QSimpleXmlNodeModel must be thread-safe.

db:section.db:title: QSimpleXmlNodeModel::QSimpleXmlNodeModel(const QXmlNamePool &namePool)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QSimpleXmlNodeModel for use with with the specified namePool.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QUrl QSimpleXmlNodeModel::baseUri(const QXmlNodeModelIndex &node) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the base URI for node. This is always the document URI.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QXmlNodeModelIndex QSimpleXmlNodeModel::elementById(const QXmlName &id) const
db:section.db:para: Always returns a default constructed QXmlNodeModelIndex instance, regardless of id.
This effectively means the model has no elements that have an id.

db:section.db:title: QXmlNamePool &QSimpleXmlNodeModel::namePool() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name pool associated with this model. The implementation of name() will use this name pool to create names.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QVector<QXmlName> QSimpleXmlNodeModel::namespaceBindings(const QXmlNodeModelIndex &node) const
db:section.db:para: Always returns an empty QVector. This signals that no namespace bindings are in scope for node.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QVector<QXmlNodeModelIndex> QSimpleXmlNodeModel::nodesByIdref(const QXmlName &idref) const
db:section.db:para: Always returns an empty vector, regardless of idref.
This effectively means the model has no elements or attributes of type IDREF.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QString QSimpleXmlNodeModel::stringValue(const QXmlNodeModelIndex &node) const
db:section.db:para: If node is an element or attribute, typedValue() is called, and the return value converted to a string, as per XQuery's rules.
If node is another type of node, the empty string is returned.

If this function is overridden for comments or processing instructions, it is important to remember to call it (for elements and attributes having values not of type xs:string) to ensure that the values are formatted according to XQuery.
